Name: Paloma Perez
Description:
The victim's body was found under a bridge in a garbage bag and showed signs of utter cruelity. After strangling the victim, the perpetrators stabbed, beheaded and burnt the victim's body.

TvT partner organization TV Mex - Travestis Mexico, Summary 2011; Nuevo Ojo, online portal, 3.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found naked and covered with litter bags in a canal, showing stab wounds in the chest, arms, hands and knees. The authorities belief the killing was committed in a different location.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Noticia al Dia, online journal, 4.10.2011

Name: Tierrita (José Manuel Concepción)
Description:
Tierrita was a sex worker and lived in the district of Villa Mella.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Nacional, online journal, 5.10.2011

Name: Paloma (Joaquim) Rodrigues da Cunha
Description:
Paloma was run over by a car. According to witnesses, she was using crack and, experiencing a psychotic crisis, she threw herself onto a highway, where she was killed. A smoking pipe was found nearby that the police belief belonged to Paloma.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Jangadeiro, online portal, 6.10.2011

Name: Ramazan Cetin
Description:
The victim was shot by her brother in a hospital in front of other patients. The brother confessed to the police, that he killed her becuase she "was engaged in transvestism" and that he "cleansed his honour". The victim was suffering from violence from her family before.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: TvT partner organization Pembe Hayat & The Advocate, 08.10.2011

Name: Ceci (Rubén Rolando Montenegro)
Description:
Ceci was a sex worker. She was shot in the head and shoulder in a hostel. Pablo Alejandro Peralta was arrested and charged with murder.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Siglo, online portal, 12.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim's body was found in a garbage bag under the table in the apartment of 21 year-old Germán Alejo Torres, after neighbours had noticed a strong smell and called the police. The head, arms and legs had been cut off and put on the pavement to be picked up by the refuse collection. Torres confessed the crime. The victim could be identified preliminarily due to a tatoo and was presumably a sex worker.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: La Voz, online journal, 16.10.2011

Name: Joana (Sergio Ricardo) Faria
Description: TvT partner organization: Grupo Gay da Bahia (Tabelas 2011)

Name: (Jefferson) Diogo de Cezaro
Location: Rua Bento Gonçalves, Caxias do Sul, RS
Description:
The victim was strangled and thrown out of a car. A witness reported the car's plate number to the police, who arrested the car owner and a second man.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Rede Trans, online portal.

Name: Elisa Sabatella Brasil
Description: ‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Thonny Hawany, blog, 18.10.2011

Name: (Maicon Michel) Cardoso da Silva Westenhofen
Source ref: 15 Oct 2011/(Maicon Michel) Cardoso da Silva Westenhofen
Description:
The victim's body was found with marks of torture and a stab wound in the chest in the river Taquari. The police belief that the victim was killed on the weekend of 15/16 October, as the victim was missing since 15 October.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Gazeto do Sul, online portal, 19.10.2011

Name: (José de Arimatéia da Silva)
Description:
The victim was from the city of Campina Grande. The mother stated she suspected prejudice to be the reason of the murder.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Gay 1, online portal, 17.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Description:
The victim was killed with two other people during a private party by militants coming from outside of the village, who entered the party and opened fire killing three people and injuring two people. The locals said the attack won't affect their morale.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: The Express Tribune, 20.10.2011

Name: Carolina González Abad ("La Moma")
Description:
La Moma's body was found by her brother half-naked on her bed with a scarf around her neck. As well as being strangled she had sustained deep blows to the head and a stab wound in one leg.

Her two dogs, Taylor and Pamela had also been killed.

> "She was killed by inequality, the continuous violence in which she always lived; because a trans woman these days has no choice but to go on the streets to survive. We remember her well, always laughing and mocking the attacks of the ignorant who insulted her and discriminated against her because of her gender; showing himself indifferent to that in order to move forward," recalled her friends.
> 
> La Moma was a baby in a great body, totally honest, to the point of always saying what she thought. She was 36 years old and lacked some common sense, but she had no evil. She was a totally happy person, inside her bubble and in spite of the very poor economic conditions in which she had to live. She laughed at the tragedy and had an acidic humour. And she had managed to weave genuine friendship relationships.
> 
> She was a granddaughter of a judge, daughter of separated parents and had two brothers. She got along well with everyone in her family, even though they still called her by her deadname. Her father paid her rent for her home, but he could not help her anymore than that. To eat, prostitution was her only choice. 

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: El Dia, online journal, 9.11.11

https://primerapagina.info/2018/06/07/insolito-habrian-perdido-pruebas-clave-para-resolver-el-asesinato-de-una-travesti/

https://pulsonoticias.com.ar/2521/travesticidio-de-la-moma-radio-abierta-y-gritos-de-justicia/

https://pulsonoticias.com.ar/6046/pintaron-un-mural-para-recordar-a-la-moma/

Name: Lulu
Description: ‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Personeria de Medellin, Boletin de Prensa No. 159, 21.10.2011

Name: Talha
Description:
The victim was shot in a shop, when resisting a robbery.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Daily Times, 23.10.2011

Name: Dudu (Eduardo) Paixão de Jesus
Description:
The victim had survived an attempted murder the previous year, where Dudu was shot six times.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Grupo Contra o Preconceito, blog, 24.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Location: Rua Professor Onésimo Silveira, Sao Paulo, SP
Description:
Two travestis were found dead in a park on 23 October.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Camacari Noticias/Grupo Contra o Preconceito, 24.10.2011

Name: Name Unknown
Location: Rua Professor Onésimo Silveira, Sao Paulo, SP
Description:
Two travestis were found dead in a park on 23 October.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Camacari Noticias/Grupo Contra o Preconceito, 24.10.2011

Name: (Cristian Yoneiker) Torres Escuraima
Description:
Various persons fired shots at a group of sex workers in the early morning. 'Cristian' was shot at least 20 times. He had told a relative that it had occurred several times already that shots had been fired at them only to scare them and make them run away.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: La Nacion, online journal, 23.10.2011

Name: Shelley 'Treasure' Hilliard
Description:
After Shelley was killed her body was burned.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Detroit News, 10.11.2011

Name: Malu (Antenor Manoel) dos Santos Moraes
Location: Avenida Rio Madeira, Porto Velho, RO
Description:
The victim was a sex worker and was stabbed by a supposed client who had already attacked another travesti sex worker several days before. The police was looking for the perpetrator.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Rondoniagora/Jornal Policial, 25.10.2011

Name: "Luis" Chichay Kano ("The Key")
Description:
The victim was set on fire after a dispute with her partner. She died 8 dies later in the hospital.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Latin America Current Evenets, 24.10.2011

Name: Fogao (Adilson) Ferreira Rodrigues
Description:
Fogao's body was found in the morning near a gymnasium. Next to the body, two knifes and a brick with marks of blood were found.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: TV Alterosa, online portal, 24.10.2011; Jornal Fama, online portal, 25.10.2011

Name: Gabi (Davi) Pereira Dantas
Description:
Gabi had moved to Lagarto from the city of Aracaju shortly before being killed in order to work as a cleaner.

‘Transrespect versus Transphobia Worldwide’ research project: Sergipe Hoje, online portal, 28.10.2011
